container.heading: Personal Residential Permits for
container.reason: Reserved Parking Spaces for Permanently Disabled Persons

section.heading: Definition.
section.text: "Applicant" means for the purpose of administering Transportation Article, §21-1005, Annotated Code of Maryland, an individual who has a physical disability.

para.text: The application form shall be distributed upon request by the Administration.
The application shall be completed in full and signed by the applicant or the applicant's representative.
An application not signed by the physically disabled applicant, or the parent or guardian of a minor applicant, will be rejected.
The Administration shall mail permits to individuals whose applications have been approved.
Applications received for residents of Baltimore City shall be forwarded to the Baltimore City Department of Transportation for processing.
Applications received for residents of Baltimore County shall be forwarded to the Baltimore County Department of Traffic Engineering for processing.
A signed or certified statement from a licensed physician is required for an application for a permit. This statement shall certify that the applicant has a permanent physical disability that:
Requires the applicant to use a wheelchair to move about; or
Is so severe that the applicant would endure a hardship or be subject to a risk of injury if the applicant should enter or leave a vehicle at a less convenient location.
The Administration, at its discretion, may:
Allow the physically disabled applicant to submit the statement from a licensed physician with the application; or
Obtain the statement directly from the licensed physician.
An applicant may be issued a permit for the use of only one reserved parking space.
For the convenience of the applicant, an additional two permits for the use of the reserved parking space may be issued for vehicles belonging to members of the applicant's household.
Permits are not transferable.
Permits may only be used on household vehicles.

section.heading: Display of Permits.
section.text: The parking permit shall be displayed as specified by the Administration.

para.text: The reserved parking space shall be located as near the front, side, or edge of the applicant's property line as possible.
The reserved space may not be longer than 25 feet in length.
A reserved parking space may not be authorized to the applicant whose property has adequate and accessible off-street parking available.
A reserved parking space may not be authorized for any roadways that have parking or other restrictions prohibiting parking at any time.
All reserved parking spaces on roadways that have established restrictions prohibiting parking at certain times shall also be restricted to the prohibited times.
A vehicle using a reserved parking space shall be parked entirely within the space.
Reserved parking spaces shall be used when possible instead of other public parking spaces.

section.heading: Sign.
section.text: A handicapped parking sign shall contain a "wheelchair" symbol and the permit number, and be in a form specified by the Administrator of the State Highway Administration.

para.text: Except in Baltimore City and Baltimore County, upon approval by the Motor Vehicle Administration, the State Highway Administration shall erect the authorized handicapped parking sign.
In Baltimore City and Baltimore County, approval and erection of authorized handicapped parking signs shall be performed by the respective jurisdiction.

section.heading: Revocation of Parking Permit and Reserved Parking Space.
section.text: A reserved space and all parking permits shall be immediately revoked by the Motor Vehicle Administration upon receiving evidence:

para.text: Of false statements on the application;
Of the misuse of the parking privilege;
Of the rezoning or reclassification of the roadway restrictions to prohibit parking at any time;
That the permit holder's disability has improved to the point where the permit holder can safely enter or leave a vehicle at a less convenient location;
That the permit holder's dwelling unit or adjacent property has been modified to provide adequate and accessible off-street parking; or
That the permit holder has failed or refused to provide documentation to substantiate the permit holder's continued need for reserved parking, when requested by the Administration.

section.heading: Notification to State Highway Administration.
section.text: A copy of the application shall be forwarded to the State Highway Administration immediately after approval.
